action.action-desc: Ms. Wilson of Florida (for herself, Mr. Hastings, and Ms. Frankel of Florida) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to authorize the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award grants to nursing homes, assisted living facilities, and other long-term care facilities to improve their preparedness for power outages.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Disaster Preparedness for Power Outages Act of 2018.

section.header: Improving the preparedness of nursing homes, assisted living facilities, and other long-term care facilities for power outages
section.text: The Public Health Service Act is amended by inserting after section 319C–2 of such Act (42 U.S.C. 247d–3b) the following new section:

section.header: Improving the preparedness of nursing homes, assisted living facilities, and other long-term care facilities for power outages

subsection.text: The Secretary may award grants to nursing homes, assisted living facilities, and other long-term care facilities to improve their preparedness for power outages, including during and after a natural disaster.
The preparedness activities funded through a grant under this section may include—

paragraph.text: the purchase of a backup power source, such as a generator, and any related equipment; and
the creation of a regional resource directory on disaster and post-disaster preparedness for power outages.

subsection.text: In awarding grants under this section, the Secretary shall give preference to nursing homes, assisted living facilities, and other long-term care facilities that—

clause.text: individuals who are enrolled in a State plan under title XIX of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396 et seq.) (or under a waiver of such plan); and

subparagraph.text: have a high risk of hurricanes or other natural disasters; and

paragraph.text: have not been cited for a substantive Federal, State, or local violation.

subsection.text: To carry out this section, there are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary.
